results.title: Passionless moments
results.brief_description: A series of suburban vignettes dealing with everyday eccentricities. Filmed in black and white, this is an early work by renowned New Zealand filmmaker Jane Campion. Through a series of alternately ironic and bizarre vignettes, the filmmaker composes a joyful celebration to the beauty of the mundane and the ordinary.

results.title: Kitchen sink
results.brief_description: A woman finds an unidentified root growing out of her kitchen sink plug hole. The umbilical like vine grows into an adult male covered in hair from head to toe. The woman shaves the catatonic man and the two begin to play out a primal scene of lust and longing. Alison Maclean’s perverse horror recasts desire in its most primordial and visceral guise.

results.title: Joy
results.creator_credit: Cate Shortland, Rachel Clements and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Thursday night. Late night shopping. Joy wants to have fun. This film follows a teenage girl as she hits the town in search of a good time. But Joy’s search for fulfilment leaves her lost and lonely at the end of the evening as we follow her to her unhappy home. By the director of Somersault (2004) Original format 35 mm/colour
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may offend some viewers

results.title: Beach story
results.brief_description: A family spends the day at the beach. The tensions between mother, daughter and father lead all three characters to isolate themselves as much as they can from each other - creating interior worlds within the larger open expanse of sand, surf, sand and horizon. This intimate and elegantly executed short film is a moving examination of one seemingly ordinary day that will change the dynamics of the family for all time.

results.title: Jem Cohen interviewed by Emma Crimmings
results.brief_description: Jem Cohen talks with Emma Crimmings about his relationship with cities and curating a secret museum of unseeen human activity. He describes the qualities and significance of Super 8 film and cameras. He talks about attempts to categorise his work and the limitations of terms such as ‘poetic’ or ‘experimental’. Works such as ‘Lost Book Found’ and ‘This is a History of New York’ are discussed as well as his methodology as an independent film-maker. The discussion also touches on his work with music video and shooting the conflict between the regional and global in Melbourne.

results.title: Pegged in
results.brief_description: The secret life of a peg! A comic animation of common wooden pegs who, once left alone in a laundry basket, come to life and sprout legs. This quirky short has the pegs getting caught up in a string, one burns itself of an iron, and they all conspire to release two of their fellow pegs from a shirt pocket, in the process cause chaos.
